title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises Red Sox teammates to simplify their game as the team aims to secure a playoff spot.
Red Sox hold second American League wildcard spot with a record of 81-68, facing a challenging end to the season.
Boston is 4-6 in their last 10 games, risking a series sweep by the Yankees if they lose on Sunday.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution and Toronto FC drew 1-1 at Gillette Stadium on Saturday night.
Luca Langoni scored a last-minute equalizer, keeping Revolution's slim playoff hopes technically alive.
Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start at 18, impressing with his composed midfield performance.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox hold the second AL wild card spot, trailing Yankees by 1.5 games and Blue Jays by 4.5 games.
Alex Cora urges team to focus on current games rather than playoffs, citing uncertainties and need for lineup adjustments.
Despite Red Sox slump, ESPN and FanGraphs give over 90% postseason probability; Baseball-Reference slightly higher at 92.9%.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is focused on hiring a general manager for the Red Sox this offseason, WEEI's Rob Bradford reported.
The Red Sox have not had a general manager since Breslow took over as chief baseball officer in 2024.
Possible candidates for the GM role include assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade Ja'Lynn Polk to Saints; receive 2027 sixth-round pick, give 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round pick, had 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns in his rookie season.
Polk's 2025 season ended with a shoulder injury; Patriots have six receivers under contract for 2026.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face a challenge against Dolphins, having lost their last five games in Miami.
Dolphins' struggles include a blowout loss to Colts and a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa holds a perfect 7-0 record against Patriots as Dolphins' quarterback.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic themed concert at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
The setlist included tracks from 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You,' showcasing a rich narrative universe.
The show featured atmospheric stage design, with a surprise duet with Jae Matthews from Boy Harsher.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt, a college player who returned to play at 59.
Chiklis, age 62, returns to the gridiron for the film after last playing football in high school 45 years ago.
The movie, directed by Rod Lurie, will have a Boston screening on Sept. 14 before its national release on Sept. 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are included in the Forbes list of the 400 richest Americans for 2025.
Abigail Johnson is the richest in Massachusetts, ranked 27th with a net worth of $35 billion.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft is 78th on the list with a net worth of $13.8 billion.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lose 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway, managing only two hits despite five walks during the game.
Lucas Giolito allows two runs over 5.2 innings, while Boston struggles offensively without Roman Anthony and Wilyer Abreu.
Yankees capitalize on Boston's errors, with Red Sox committing three mistakes, including Carlos Narvaez's interference call.
